page.title: 02HOUSING IN ASTLEY BRIDGE
page.content: Our area of Astley Bridge was once a small village.Some of the area's houses are well over a hundred years old.Many of these are stone terraced and were originally built to house the mill workers. Through the years the population of Astley Bridge has grown;red brick terraces have been built instead of stone.New estates of semi-detached and detached houses have been built to house the new population who work further a field.There are three blocks of flats in our area,none of which are tower blocks. Some of the older houses have now been demolished, but no new houses have been built on these sites. In fact the only new building work in progress at the present time involves the building of old people's bungalows.
